Text.Text: PAL Mini Wheel

Text.Name: Heading (1)
Text.Text: Base Construction

Text.Name: Text (1)
Text.Text:
Umbra Space Industries introduces it's yellowest venture yet Konstruction! Konstruction adds new parts and game mechanics to KSP centered around base and orbital construction!
Weldable, configurable construction ports, with auto-rotation and configurable parameters on the fly. Once connected, these can be removed, resulting in a permanent joint between the parent parts of the two ports.
Design your assembly in the VAB, cut it up and add construction ports, reassemble in-situ.
Great for large bases and stations, or building larger vessels in orbit!

Text.Name: Heading
Text.Text: Tundra Inflatables

Text.Name: Main Article (1)
Text.Text:
Inflatables are designed as lightweight shells that need to be inflated and filled with equipment before they are useful. MaterialKits can be 'Scavanged' see Logistics for more info...
This necessitates more launches but allows for smaller payloads which is useful early on in your space career.
The equipment is made on site and instantly using MaterialKits by an Engineer on EVA. When you are on EVA in the part action window you will find the deploy button available. You will get a warning if enough MaterialKits are not available.
These HabModules can operate as either a hab extenders (as private quarters) or as Agricultural modules.

Text.Name: Hab Text (19)
Text.Text: All of the comforts of home in a convenient, expandable package. Not for use as a bouncy castle. Can be configured as agricultural space or living space. See the Habitation or Production section for more information...

Text.Name: Hab Text (18)
Text.Text:
Expansion requires 46,000 MaterialKits & 4000 Electric Charge
Switching modes requires 316 SpecializedParts & 1580 MaterialKits & 1580 Electric Charge

Text.Name: Hab Text (17)
Text.Text: An expandable module that can be configured as agricultural space or living space. Expands from 2.5m to 2.75m See the Habitation or Production section for more information...

Text.Name: Hab Text (16)
Text.Text:
Expansion requires 2000 MaterialKits & 200 Electric Charge
Switching modes requires 75 SpecializedParts & 375 MaterialKits & 375 Electric Charge

Text.Name: Hab Text (15)
Text.Text: An expandable module that can be configured as agricultural space or living space. Expands from 3.75m to 4.25m. See the Habitation or Production section for more information...

Text.Name: Hab Text (14)
Text.Text:
Expansion requires 1000 MaterialKits & 100 Electric Charge
Switching modes requires 17 SpecializedParts & 85 MaterialKits & 85 Electric Charge

Text.Name: Heading
Text.Text: Tundra Parts

Text.Name: Heading (1)
Text.Text: 'Tundra' 2.5m Adapter An attachment cap suitable for 2.5m parts. Comes automatically applied to all 2.5m 'Tundra' Modules when using the outer node.

Text.Name: Heading (2)
Text.Text: 'Tundra' 3.75m Adapter An attachment cap suitable for 3.75m parts. Comes automatically applied to all 3.75m 'Tundra' Modules when using the outer node.

Text.Name: Heading (3)
Text.Text: 'Tundra' Airlock - An airlock module suitable for use with the 'Tundra' series for orbital or surface bases. Seats 4 Crew. Provides no Habitation value. 1,000l KIS Storage

Text.Name: Heading (4)
Text.Text: 'Tundra' Mini Airlock A smaller airlock module suitable for use with the 'Tundra' series for orbital or surface bases. Seats 1 Crew. Provides no Habitation value.

Text.Name: Heading (5)
Text.Text: 'Tundra' 2.5M Hub (Short) When you have to branch your base out, use this hub to link trusses and other modules. Suitable for Tundra 2.5m modules and other base components. 3,000l KIS Storage.

Text.Name: Heading (6)
Text.Text: 'Tundra' 2.5M Hub When you have to branch your base out, use this hub to link trusses and other modules. Suitable for Tundra 2.5m modules and other base components. 3,000l KIS Storage.

Text.Name: Heading (7)
Text.Text: 'Tundra' MultiHub The Multi-Hub features attachment points at heights suitable at MKS 'Ranger' and 'Tundra' (both 2.5m and 3.75m) product lines. 10,000l KIS Storage See 'Base Construction' for more info . . .

Text.Name: Heading (8)
Text.Text: MiniTruss A smaller tube suitable for connecting various MKS modules. Attachment styles include 'Ranger' style doughnut connectors, standard 1.25m nodes, and flush mounts suitable for linking trusses together, or attaching to larger surfaces.

Text.Name: Heading (9)
Text.Text: MultiTruss A tube suitable for connecting various MKS modules. Attachment styles include 'Ranger' style doughnut connectors, standard 1.25m nodes, and flush mounts suitable for linking trusses together, or attaching to larger surfaces.

Text.Name: Heading (10)
Text.Text: 'Salamander' Command Pod A ruggedized two man pod with an integrated avionics system and a basic life support recycler, ideal for colony dropships.

Text.Name: Heading (11)
Text.Text: 'Scout' Landing Module - Mk2 Light, with a wide landing stance, the Scout landing module is ideal for landing your first colony modules, even on rough terrain. Features 'weight transfer' to automatically balance the weight of 'Ranger' modules attached to the sides. 1,000l KIS Storage See 'Base Construction for more info . . .

Text.Name: Text (2)
Text.Text: Tundra Module List

Text.Name: Text
Text.Text: 2.5m Form Factor

Text.Name: Text (1)
Text.Text: 3.75m Form Factor

Text.Name: Text (3)
Text.Text: This module brings more advanced farming techniques to your colony. It can take advantage of 'Ranger' Agriculture Module in [GreenHouse] mode to increase efficiency. This module will help replenish your supplies through a variety of agriculture options. Ensure an experienced scientist is on board for optimal efficiency. Seats 2 Crew. See 'Manufacturing' & 'Efficiency & Load' for more info. . .

Text.Name: Text (4)
Text.Text: This module is outfitted to provide long range power distribution, including large battery stores, and a small nuclear power plant. Radiators not included. Seats 2 Crew. See 'Power' for more info. . .

Text.Name: Text (5)
Text.Text: The Kerbitat brings you all of the comforts of home, in a package guaranteed to have at least 30% less explosive decompression than our competitors. Can be configured as a life support recycler, crew quarters, or outfitted with comfort and exercise features to make your Kerbal more comfortable. Seats 2 Crew. See 'Habitation' for more info. . .

Text.Name: Text (6)
Text.Text: The Kerbitat brings you all of the comforts of home, in a package guaranteed to have at least 30% less explosive decompression than our competitors. Can be configured as a life support recycler, crew quarters, or outfitted with comfort and exercise features to make your Kerbal more comfortable. Seats 4 Crew. See 'Habitation' for more info. . .

Text.Name: Text (7)
Text.Text: Designed for longer term settlements, this advanced Colonization Module provides ample room and amenities for long term habitation. Checking for Colony Rewards is not automatic, and is a function of the Pioneer Module. Rewards are accumulated with any MKS module, but can only be collected once a Pioneer Module is present. The Colonist Module consumes ColonySupplies, and in return, suspends both habitation timers for your Kerbals. Seats 2 Crew. See 'Med Bay & Colony Supplies' for more info. . .

Text.Name: Text (8)
Text.Text: Logistics Module 2.5 Designed to be one of the first parts of a long term colony, the Pioneer module features local logistics capabilities, basic training facilities, recycling facilities for life support, KerbNet access, and survey station capabilities for off-world construction. Rewards are accumulated with any MKS module, but can only be collected once a Pioneer Module is present. Pioneer Modules may now perform a Resource Scan which will identify nearby 'Resource Lodes'. Seats 2 Crew. See 'Logistics', 'Med Bay & Colony Supplies', ‘Active Resource Harvesting’ & 'Ship Building' for more info. . .

Text.Name: Text (9)
Text.Text: The Agricultural Support Module is designed to support off-world farming on an industrial scale, with three configurable bays that can be set up for fertilizer generation or water extraction from a variety of materials. It can take advantage of 'Ranger' Crush-O-Matic in [Crusher] mode to increase efficiency. Seats 4 Crew. See 'Manufacturing' & 'Efficiency & Load' for more info. . .

Text.Name: Text (10)
Text.Text: A large refinery designed to support off-world resource exploitation on an industrial scale, with three configurable bays that can be set up to refine a variety of resources into useful products. Ensure an experienced engineer is on board and is fully supplied with Machinery for optimal efficiency. Can take advantage of the 'Ranger' Smelt-O-Matic [Smelter] to increase the efficiency. Seats 4 Crew. See 'Manufacturing' & 'Efficiency & Load' for more info. . .

Text.Name: Text (11)
Text.Text: An off-world manufacturing facility suitable for large-scale fabrication. Can be configured as either MaterialKits, Machinery, ColonySupplies or SpecializedParts production. Ensure an experienced engineer is on board and is fully supplied with Machinery for optimal efficiency. Can take advantage of the 'Ranger' Inflatable Workshop [Workshop] to increase the efficiency. Engineers on-board will also perform automatic maintenance of all modules within 150m keeping your production lines fully stocked, requires a reserve of machinery. Seats 4 Crew. See 'Manufacturing' & 'Efficiency & Load' for more info. . .

Text.Name: Text (12)
Text.Text: A large, mobile recycling plant that can take broken parts and other recyclables, and reclaim a portion of their raw materials. Ensure an experienced engineer is on board and is fully supplied with Machinery for optimal efficiency. Seats 4 Crew. See 'Manufacturing' for more info . . .

Text.Name: Text (13)
Text.Text: Processing plant for nuclear fuel production and refinement. The centrifuge processes Uraninite using machines spinning really fast and produces EnrichedUranium. DepletedFuel can also be reprocessed with USI Breeder technology, coaxing out every bit of EnrichedUranium left in the fuel. Suitable for interplanetary operations, spacecraft, stations, and surface bases (radiators not included.) Centrifuge not suitable for Kerbal entertainment purposes. Ensure an experienced engineer is on board and is fully supplied with Machinery for optimal efficiency. Seats 4 Crew. See 'Manufacturing' for more info . . .

Text.Name: Text (14)
Text.Text: Designed to take in vast amounts of dirt and extract it's useful contents, this industrial sifter redefines the meaning of 'Resource Exploitation'. Ensure an experienced engineer is on board and is fully supplied with Machinery for optimal efficiency. When resources lodes are grappled, the sifter resource into a variety of other resources based on planetary composition (similar to how Dirt works).Seats 4 Crew. See 'Manufacturing' & 'Efficiency & Load' & Active Resource Harvesting For More Information . . .

Text.Name: Text (15)
Text.Text: This module brings more advanced farming techniques to your colony. It can take advantage of 'Ranger' Agriculture Module in [GreenHouse] mode to increase efficiency. This module will help replenish your supplies through a variety of agriculture options. Ensure an experienced scientist is on board for optimal efficiency. Seats 4 Crew. See 'Manufacturing' & 'Efficiency & Load' for more info. . .

Text.Name: Text (16)
Text.Text: A field training center for training your Kerbonauts. When training is conducted, attendees will gain experience based on the instructors present, and in their chosen field. Up to one star when used on Kerbin, two stars while in orbit, and three stars if training takes place landed on another planet or moon. Seats 12 Crew. See 'Crew Training' for more info. . .

Text.Name: Text (17)
Text.Text: Designed for longer term settlements, this advanced Colonization Module provides ample room and amenities for long term habitation. Checking for Colony Rewards is not automatic, and is a function of the Pioneer Module. Rewards are accumulated with any MKS module, but can only be collected once a Pioneer Module is present. The Colonist Module consumes ColonySupplies, and in return, suspends both habitation timers for your Kerbals. Seats 6 Crew. See 'Med Bay & Colony Supplies' for more info. . .

Text.Name: Text (18)
Text.Text: When mishaps befall your Kerbals, or when Kerbals become homesick, simply transfer them into the medical bay, and any scientist on your crew can help them become happy and healthy again. Only works on Kerbals inside of the module, consumes ColonySupplies. Includes medical facilities for 4 Kerbals. See 'Med Bay & Colony Supplies' for more info. . .

Text.Name: Heading
Text.Text: Tundra Series

Text.Name: Text
Text.Text: Permanent Base Parts in both 2.5m and 3.75m form factors. Conversion rates for resource production and construction are much larger than the previous Duna modules. Also includes more advanced modules like the Nuclear Fuel Processor. Fully self-sustaining bases are not possible without using Tundra Modules. Tundra modules do not have any landing leg’s which makes them perfect to us as space station parts. It is recommended to use the Cradles from USI Konstruction for horizontal placement or the included ‘Scout' Landing Module for vertical placement.

Text.Name: Text (1)
Text.Text: Permanent Base Parts in both 2.5m and 3.75m form factors. Conversion rates for resource production and construction are much larger than the previous Duna modules. Also includes more advanced modules like the Nuclear Fuel Processor. Fully self-sustaining bases are not possible without using Tundra Modules. Tundra modules do not have any landing leg’s which makes them perfect to us as space station parts. It is recommended to use the Cradles from USI Konstruction for horizontal placement or the included ‘Scout' Landing Module for vertical placement.

Text.Name: Text (1)
Text.Text: Duna Part List

Text.Name: Text
Text.Text: Designed to be one of the first parts of a long term colony, the Pioneer module features local logistics capabilities, basic training facilities, recycling facilities for life support, KerbNet access, and survey station capabilities for off-world construction. Rewards are accumulated with any MKS module, but can only be collected once a Pioneer Module is present. Pioneer Modules may now perform a Resource Scan which will identify nearby 'Resource Lodes'. See 'Logistics', 'Med Bay & Colony Supplies', ‘Active Resource Harvesting’ & 'Ship Building' for more info. . .

Text.Name: Text (2)
Text.Text: The MKS Kerbitat brings you all of the comforts of home, in a package guaranteed to have at least 30% less explosive decompression than our competitors. It can be configured as a life support recycler (stand-alone or planetary water filtration), or as shared living space for your Kerbals. Seats 2 Crew. See 'Habitation' for more info. . .

Text.Name: Text (3)
Text.Text: When mishaps befall your Kerbals, or when Kerbals become homesick, simply transfer them into the medical bay, and any scientist on your crew can help them become happy and healthy again. Only works on Kerbals inside of the module, consumes ColonySupplies. Includes medical facilities for two Kerbals. Seats 2 Crew. See 'Med Bay & Colony Supplies' for more info. . .

Text.Name: Text (4)
Text.Text: The Logistics Center allows the vessel (and the resource warehouses attached directly to it) to participate in planetary logistics, taking or storing resources in planetary stockpiles. The Logistics Center will scan any directly attached warehouses for resources to send to the planetary pool. This is best used at points where resources are generated or consumed. Seats 2 Crew. Requires a Pilot. See 'Logistics for more info. . .

Text.Name: Text (5)
Text.Text: Designed for longer term settlements, this advanced Colonization Module provides ample room and amenities for long term habitation. Supports a single Kerbal. Checking for Colony Rewards is not automatic, and is a function of the Pioneer Module. Rewards are accumulated with any MKS module, but can only be collected once a Pioneer Module is present. The Colonist Module consumes ColonySupplies, and in return, suspends both habitation timers for your Kerbals. Seats 1 Crew. See 'Med Bay & Colony Supplies' for more info. . .

Text.Name: Text (6)
Text.Text: This module brings more advanced farming techniques to your colony. While it's own space is limited, it can take advantage of 'Ranger' Agriculture Module in [GreenHouse] to increase efficiency. This module will help replenish your supplies through a variety of agriculture options. Ensure an experienced scientist is on board for optimal efficiency. Seats 2 Crew. See 'Manufacturing' & 'Efficency & Load' for more info. . .

Text.Name: Text (7)
Text.Text: This module is outfitted to provide long range power distribution, including large battery stores, and a small nuclear power plant. Radiators not included. Seats 2 Crew. Requires Engineer to transfer power. See 'Power' for more info. . .

Text.Name: Text (8)
Text.Text: Example of a Duna Series base supplemented by Ranger Parts

Text.Name: Text (3)
Text.Text: Duna Series

Text.Name: Text
Text.Text: Starter base parts in a 2.5m form factor. All Duna parts include landing legs. The efficiency of resource converters can be increased by using the appropriate Ranger parts. Each Duna module has 5 attachment points for parts from the Ranger Series. Duna parts are also suitable for permanent bases and full colonies as supplemental modules or where the conversion rates of the larger Tundra models are not required. Fully self-sustaining bases are not recommended using only Duna modules.

Text.Name: Text (1)
Text.Text: Ranger Inflatables

Text.Name: Main Article
Text.Text:
Inflatables are designed as lightweight shells that need to be inflated and filled with equipment before they are useful. MaterialKits can be 'Scavanged' see Logistics for more info...
This necessitates more launches but allows for smaller payloads which is useful early on in your space career.
The equipment is made on site and instantly using MaterialKits by an Engineer on EVA. When you are on EVA in the part action window you will find the deploy button available. You will get a warning if enough MaterialKits are not available.
The Inflatable Storage Modules do not require any MaterialKits to deploy and are deployed from within the craft.

Text.Name: Hab Text
Text.Text: All of the comforts of home in a convenient, expandable package. Can be configured as private living space (Habitation Extension) or outfitted as shared space (Habitation Multiplier). See the Habitation section for more information...

Text.Name: Hab Text (1)
Text.Text:
Expansion requires 8000 MaterialKits & 500 Electric Charge
Switching modes requires 61 SpecializedParts & 305 MaterialKits & 305 Electric Charge

Text.Name: Hab Text (2)
Text.Text: A workshop suitable for small-scale fabrication. Can also help increase efficiency when combined with a larger MKS Fabrication module. Has 3 modes. Efficiency, Machinery & MaterialKits. Increase productivity when crewed for EPL. See Ship Building for more info...

Text.Name: Hab Text (3)
Text.Text:
Expansion requires 2000 MaterialKits & 200 Electric Charge
Switching modes requires 75 SpecializedParts & 375 MaterialKits & 375 Electric Charge

Text.Name: Hab Text (4)
Text.Text: An greenhouse that can be configured as an algae-based farm and biological filter using either recycled waste (yuck!) orlocal resources (either substrate or dirt, plus water). Can be used to supplement larger greenhouse-type modules. Requires a scientist is on board for optimal efficiency. See Resource Production for more info...

Text.Name: Hab Text (5)
Text.Text:
Expansion requires 1000 MaterialKits & 100 Electric Charge
Switching modes requires 17 SpecializedParts & 85 MaterialKits & 85 Electric Charge

Text.Name: Hab Text (6)
Text.Text: A small storage module connected to the warehouse network. Can be configured for multiple resources in 10 convenient groups. See Logistics for more info...

Text.Name: Hab Text (7)
Text.Text:
Expansion requires No MaterialKits
Switching modes requires No MaterialKits

Text.Name: Hab Text (8)
Text.Text: #1 MetallicOre;Substrate;Minerals;Water #2 Chemicals;Polymers;Metals #3 Machinery Recyclables;MeterialKits #4 LiquidFuel;Oxidizer;Karbonite #5 Monopropellant;SolidFuel;LqdHydrogen

Text.Name: Hab Text (9)
Text.Text: #6 Supplies;Mulch;Fertilizer #7 Gypsum;Hydrates;Dirt #8 Ore;Uraninite #9 RareMetals;ExoticMinerals;RefinedExotics #10 Silicates;Silicon;SpecializedParts

Text.Name: Text (1)
Text.Text: Ranger Part List

Text.Name: Text
Text.Text: Agricultural Module An expandable greenhouse that can be configured as an algae-based farm and biological filter using either recycled waste (yuck!) or local resources (either substrate or dirt, plus water). Requires fertilzer, and can be converted to an efficiency part [Greenhouse] to enhance the 'Ranger' & 'Tundra' Agriculture Modules. Ensure an experienced scientist is on board for optimal efficiency. See 'Manufacturing' & 'Efficency & Load' for more info. . .

Text.Name: Text (2)
Text.Text: Airlock Small Airlock with space for one crew member. This part offers no habitation space.

Text.Name: Text (3)
Text.Text: Anchor Hub A small inflatable-style hub for connecting tubes and mounting Ranger parts includes landing struts and a small probe core making it ideal for the starting point of a base. Includes 'Load Transfer Technology' see 'Landing Parts' for more info . . .

Text.Name: Text (4)
Text.Text: Ball Hub A small inflatable-style hub for connecting tubes. Includes 'Load Transfer Technology' see 'Landing Parts' for more info . . .

Text.Name: Text (5)
Text.Text: Auxiliary Control When you don't have space for a full command pod, this Auxiliary Control Module includes basic flight controls and instrumentation for a single kerbal.

Text.Name: Text (6)
Text.Text: Battery Pack An external battery pack for your power hungry colony operations!

Text.Name: Text (7)
Text.Text: Communications Pack A small lab with integrated communication capabilities, suitable for initial planetary exploration and ongoing research. While the capabilities are inferior to the MPL, its compact size and lower mass make this an attractive option.

Text.Name: Text (8)
Text.Text: Redi Pack When you just need a small amount of supplies.

Text.Name: Text (9)
Text.Text: 2.5m stack adapter Attach the smaller ring to the top of an MKS 'Ranger' ball hub or anchor hub. This lets you build a vertical stack MKS base off of a Tundra Multi-Truss but still fit in a 2.5 stack, and not lose the rear attachment node on the anchor / ball hub.

Text.Name: Text (10)
Text.Text: Heat Pump This module utilizes geothermal wells to transfer and store excess heat in a planetary surface. This module is more effective on cooler planets or during night cycles.

Text.Name: Text (11)
Text.Text: Inflatable Storage Module A smaller version of the discontinued MKS ILM, suitable for storing smaller quantities of materials. See 'Ranger Inflatables' for more info. . .

Text.Name: Text (12)
Text.Text: Mount Point A handy attachment point for MKS 'Ranger' style parts. Allows easy positioning of small surface-attached modules (such as science equipment, etc.). Also includes supplemental battery power.

Text.Name: Text (13)
Text.Text: Power Pack Using experimental technology, this self-contained power module can provide a steady power supply to your colony for several years, though its output will diminish over time. Not refuelable. Includes extension cords to power other nearby modules if an engineer is present. See 'Power' for more info. . .

Text.Name: Text (14)
Text.Text: Saddle Tank When you just need a small amount of supplies.

Text.Name: Text (15)
Text.Text: Crush-O-Matic Portable Extractor A lightweight multi-resource extractor configured for agricultural use. Can be set to convert either gypsum or raw minerals into fertilizer. Ensure an experienced engineer is on board and is fully supplied with Machinery for optimal efficiency. Can be converted to an efficiency part [Crusher] to enhance the 'Tundra' Agriculture Support Module. See 'Manufacturing' & 'Efficency & Load' for more info. . .

Text.Name: Text (16)
Text.Text: Regolith Sifter Shovel in dirt, crank the handle, filter out useful stuff. Useful during initial exploration due to it's light weight. Limited to resources with a planetary abundance greater than 1%. When resources lodes are grappled, both the Ranger and Tundra regolith sifters can convert the ResourceLode resource into a variety of other resources based on planetary composition (similar to how Dirt works). See Active Resource Harvesting For More Information . . .

Text.Name: Text (17)
Text.Text: Smelt-O-Matic Portable Smelter A lightweight multi-resource smelter designed for industrial use. Can convert minerals, metallic ore, and substrate into useful products. Ensure an experienced engineer is on board and is fully supplied with Machinery for optimal efficiency Can be converted to an efficiency part [Smelter] to enhance the 'Tundra' Industrial Refinery. See 'Manufacturing' & 'Efficency & Load' for more info. . .

Text.Name: Text (18)
Text.Text: Inflatable Workshop An inflatable workshop suitable for small-scale fabrication. Can be configured as either MaterialKits or Machinery production. Ensure an experienced engineer is on board and is fully supplied with Machinery for optimal efficiency Can be converted to an efficiency part [Workshop] to enhance the 'Tundra' Assembly Plant. Engineers onboard will also perform automatic maintenance of all modules within 150m keeping your production lines fully stocked. Requires a reserve of machinery. See 'Ranger Inflatables', 'Manufacturing' & 'Efficency & Load' for more info. . .

Text.Name: Text (19)
Text.Text: Habitation Module All of the comforts of home in a convenient, expandable package. Can be configured as private living space (Habitation Extension) or outfitted as shared space (Habitation Multiplier). See 'Ranger Inflatables' & 'Habitation' for more info. . .

Text.Name: Text (20)
Text.Text: Stow Pack When you just need a small amount of KIS storage.

Text.Name: Heading
Text.Text: Ranger Series

Text.Name: Text
Text.Text: Small light weight or inflatable parts. Capable of being used to build a temporary base or supplement starter bases. Parts that generate resources can be converted to Efficiency Parts using MaterialKits and/or SpecializedParts so that these parts retain some useful functions once the starter base has been upgraded with better parts from one of the next two classes. Inflatables will require the appropriate amount of MaterialKits and an engineer on EVA to inflate with one exception being the Inflatable Storage Modules.

Text.Name: Text (1)
Text.Text: Kolonization

Text.Name: Text
Text.Text:
You can access the Kolonization Dashboard by pressing:
From here you can monitor your Kolony Statistics, Local Logistics, Planetary Logistics & Recruit Kolonists.
Kolony Statistics Kolony Bonuses are accrued by spending time performing the relevant tasks on the relevant body. Geology is earned by mining activities. Botany is earned by Greenhouses and agricultural modules. Kolonization is earned by active crew members.
Recruit Kolonists You can now recruit Kolonists for 10k per crew member. Each of the 9 types provides different abilities and bonuses. You can also recruit regular crew members as you are unlikely to be able to use the astronaut facility anymore. You can also grab a random Kerbal for only 1k!
Local Logistics You can now control and monitor local logistics.
Planetary Logistics You can also now view the status of Planetary Logistics in the same Dashboard.

Text.Name: Text (1)
Text.Text: Kolonization

Text.Name: Text
Text.Text:
Kolonization Statistics & Bonuses
Kolonization statistics are rewarded based on the crew that are present on a particular body. Pilots increase the Kolonization bonus, Engineers increase the Geology bonus and Scientist increase the Botany bonus. The new professions also provide bonuses see ‘Crew Training & Professions’ . . .
Kolonization Rewards
Kolonization Rewards are accrued on any body with an MKS part and crew present. They can be collected using a pioneer module and they are collected on a per body basis(no need to have a pioneer module on every base). Rewards are given in the form of Funds, Science & Rep. For more information on which professions provide which rewards see ‘Crew Training & Professions’ . . .
Full Kolonization
Any Kerbal on a planet that has a Kolonization level of 500% and is in a vessel with a habitation rating of 1 year or more will be immune to habitation effects, as this world is now 'Kolonized'.

Text.Name: Text
Text.Text: Permanent Base Parts in both 2.5m and 3.75m form factors. Conversion rates for resource production and construction are much larger than the previous Duna modules. Also includes more advanced modules like the Nuclear Fuel Processor. Fully self-sustaining bases are not possible without using Tundra Modules. Tundra modules do not have any landing leg’s which makes them perfect to us as space station parts. It is recommended to use the Cradles from USI Konstruction for horizontal placement or the included ‘Scout' Landing Module for vertical placement.

Text.Name: Heading (1)
Text.Text:
Colonization
Colonization Modules are designed for longer term settlements, these advanced Colonization Module provides ample room and amenities for long term habitation. Checking for Colony Rewards is not automatic, and is a function of the Pioneer Module. Rewards are accumulated with any MKS module, but can only be collected once a Pioneer Module is present.
The Colonist Module consumes ColonySupplies, and in return, increases both habitation timers for your Kerbals. One your Hab timers reach the same level as the highest Habitat they've been in the Colonization Module will freeze the Hab Timers at their maximum amount.
MedBays
When mishaps befall your Kerbals, or when Kerbals become homesick, simply transfer them into the medical bay, and any scientist on your crew can help them become happy and healthy again. Only works on Kerbals inside of the module, and consumes ColonySupplies. Only works on Kerbals that have turned into 'Tourists'.

Text.Name: Heading (2)
Text.Text: MedBay & Colony Supplies

Text.Name: Text (2)
Text.Text: Crew Training

Text.Name: Text (3)
Text.Text:
USI - MKS provides a field training center for training your Kerbonauts. When training is conducted, attendees will gain experience based on the instructors present, and in their chosen field. Up to one star when used on Kerbin, two stars while in orbit, and three stars if training takes place landed on another planet or moon.
Pilot
Required for planetary logistics (within 500 m of Logistics Centre) Required for Resource Distribution (extends logistics range to 2 km) Gives Kolonization Research bonus Gives Reputation bonus
Engineer
Required for Power Distribution Unit (PDU) operation Required on EVA to switch modes on swappable converters (incl. USI-LS Nom-O-Matics) Required in Workshop to perform automated daily maintenance Can disassemble parts on EVA Can perform parts maintenance on EVA Gives Geology Research bonus Gives Funds bonus Gives efficiency bonus to Drills (and Convert-O-Trons and same as Stock and Karbonite)•
Scientist
Require at least one for Research Labs operation in Ranger CommPak Additional Scientists / experience stars add bonus to this lab research Require a Scientist in the crew to enable the Medical Bay Require a Scientist in Pioneer modules to enable KerbNet access Gives Botany Research bonus Gives Science bonus Gives an efficiency bonus to all Ag modules and Greenhouses• Gives efficiency bonus to Ranger Smelter and Crusher• Gives bonus to Workshop efficiency module• Note
• These bonuses are scaled by the ScienceSkill and DrillSkill attributes and thus increase with kerbal experience.

Text.Name: Heading
Text.Text: Efficiency & Load

Text.Name: Heading (1)
Text.Text:
There are two types of efficiency in a MKS system. One is economic efficiency. Economic efficiency is the ratio of how one resource gets converted into another resource. The stock ISRU part will convert Ore into MonoPropellant among other things. It will consume 0.5 Ore and 30 ElectricCharge, and produce 1.0 MonoPropellant and do that every second. The economic efficiency of this conversion could be stated as 1 Ore: 2 MonoPropellant, and we'll ignore ElectricCharge here because we'll assume we're working in an environment where solar panels provide us with limitless ElectricCharge. The economic efficiency doesn't tell us how quickly we can convert Ore to MonoPropellant, just that we'll need one unit of the former to produce two units of the latter.
There is also a workload efficiency which is what governs the throughput of the conversion. The ISRU part could produce as much as 1.0 MonoPropellant per second from 0.5 Ore per second, but it can't produce more. That would be the 100% workload efficient state of the IRSU. It could produce less, though. If your drill is only extracting 0.25 Ore per second, you could only produce 0.5 MonoPropellant per second. You have a 50% workload efficiency. If you need more than 1.0 MonoPropellant per second, you'll need a 2nd ISRU. Stock component conversions can range from 0% to 100% workload efficiency and are only limited by constraining the supply of input resources (the Ore or the ElectricCharge in this case) or by having no place to store the output resources in the case of a conversion that doesn't dump excess.
MKS economic efficiency works exactly as stock all the time. However, it has a more complex system for workload efficiency. MKS converters cannot operate unmanned, and their workload efficiency varies based on the overall structure of your station and of the Kerbals that operate it. You can have workload efficiencies below 100%, even when you have an abundance of input resources and plenty of space to store your output, and you can have workload efficiencies above 100% by having a well-designed vessel and a well selected crew.
MKS also adds a further mechanic using Machinery. MKS converters cannot operate without Machinery and their output is directly related to amount of Machinery present. This is called Load.
Load is the overall productivity of a module including workload efficiency and economic efficiency, a 100% load uses normal production rates.
The capacity of machinery in the part is important. With only 50% machinery stored, the part will work at half speed.

Text.Name: Heading
Text.Text: Power

Text.Name: Heading (1)
Text.Text: MKS provides a range of different power generation units in many form factors. Some incorporate automatic power distribution.

Text.Name: Heading (2)
Text.Text: Nuclear Reactor (0.625m) A compact nuclear reactor for interplanetary operations, spacecraft, stations, and surface bases. 30EC/s

Text.Name: Heading (3)
Text.Text: Nuclear Reactor (1.25m) A compact nuclear reactor for interplanetary operations, spacecraft, stations, and surface bases. 230EC/s

Text.Name: Heading (4)
Text.Text: Nuclear Reactor (2.5) A compact nuclear reactor for interplanetary operations, spacecraft, stations, and surface bases. 1550EC/s

Text.Name: Heading (5)
Text.Text: Nuclear Reactor (3.75m) A compact nuclear reactor for interplanetary operations, spacecraft, stations, and surface bases. 4500EC/s

Text.Name: Heading (6)

Not refuelable. Includes extension cords to power other nearby modules if an engineer is present. 50EC/s

Text.Name: Heading (22)
Text.Text: ExtraPlanetaryLaunchPad Basics

Text.Name: Heading (23)
Text.Text:
Ship building require ExtraPlanetary Luanchpads.
To build, you need three things:
Either the Orbital Shipyard, the Mobile Launch Platform, or a module Equipped with an ELSurveyStation & Survey Stakes.
An on-board supply of MaterialKits & SpecialzedParts. You don't need the full supply at once, so you can top it up as construction proceeds.
A crew of reasonably smart kerbals. Put your smart kerbals where they will do the most good (e.g. the workshop) and your stupid kerbals where they will do the least harm (e.g. command pods).
You can right-click on any crewed part and see its "efficiency" to see how good your Kerbal placement is. The higher your ship's total efficiency, the faster you build.
To build, right-click on your builder part (e.g. the Orbital Shipyard), open the construction window, then pick the desired ship from the VAB, SPH, or subassembly lists.
You'll be given the expected resource costs for the ship. Only the MaterialKits & SpecialzedParts cost matters at first. Once the ship's hull is finished, the same window will pop up and you can choose to transfer resources such as fuel.
That should be enough to get you started.
See 'Parts & Supplies Manufacturing' for more info . . .

Text.Name: Heading (22)
Text.Text: Malumte

Text.Name: Heading (23)
Text.Text:
The latest in USI's line of exploration rovers, the Malemute is the smaller leaner cousin to the popular Karibou.
Fits in the MK-3 Cargo Bay Expandable cargo beds Geo-Exploration Lab Side by side docking ports Full size and mini wheels Custom service bay
Malemute parts supplied separately see the USI Catalog for more info . . .

Text.Name: Heading (24)
Text.Text: Malemute Cab The main cabin of the Malemute Rover. Seats two comfortably, eight track not included. While this cab includes a nose-hatch, designers are encouraged to use the rear tail section and it's integrated airlock when customizing a Malemute.

Text.Name: Heading (25)
Text.Text: Malemute Crew Cab A large crew cabin, suitable for hauling four kerbals in relative comfort.

Text.Name: Heading (26)
Text.Text: Malemute Cargo Bed An expandable cargo bed for the Malemute Rover.

Text.Name: Heading (27)
Text.Text: Malemute Docking Module This module features large mounting points for docking ports (not included) that can be used to dock two Malemutes side by side.

Text.Name: Heading (28)
Text.Text: Malemute Flatbed A flat, expandable cargo platform.

Text.Name: Heading (29)
Text.Text: Malemute Geology Lab A mobile georesearch lab, with a built in narrow band scanner.

Text.Name: Heading (30)
Text.Text: Malemute Service Bay A service bay for storing batteries, science experiments, and snacks. Totally not a Kraken Bay. Das would approve.

Text.Name: Heading (31)

Text.Name: Heading (33)
Text.Text: Malemute Storage Tank (Short) A small storage tank suitable for hauling various resources.

Text.Name: Heading (36)

Text.Name: Heading (22)
Text.Text: Karibou Expedition Rover

Text.Name: Heading (23)
Text.Text:
A ruggedized vehicular platform for hauling, exploration, construction, and colonization.
Karibou parts supplied separately see the USI Catalog for more info . . .

Text.Name: Heading (24)
Text.Text: Karibou Expedition Rover The Karibou Expedition Rover is a ruggedized, long-range rover capable of cargo hauling, exploration, and general construction. Its modular design also makes it an ideal platform for building heavy surface bases, such as the USI Kolonization System.

Text.Name: Heading (25)
Text.Text: Karibou Adapter Plate A 2.5m adapter plate for the Karibou Expedition Rover featuring integrated landing struts and a small amount of storage space.

Text.Name: Heading (26)
Text.Text: Karibou Cargo Bay A large cargo bay designed for use with the Karibou Expedition Rover. Features fold-out ramps and ample attachment points.

Text.Name: Heading (27)
Text.Text: Karibou Crew Cab Useable both as a long term rigid habitation module as well as additional passenger space, this ruggedized crew cabin can keep four Kerbals comfortable for over five years.

Text.Name: Heading (28)
Text.Text: Karibou Passenger Cabin Some of the accountants were going over the numbers for the Mun missions, and wondered why we needed so many TVs for short drives. So Bill went and tore out everything from a Crew Cab, and filled it with seats. It fits a lot more Kerbals now, though there's been some grumbling about a 'sardine can'.

Text.Name: Heading (29)
Text.Text: Karibou Wheeled Storage Bay This heavy wheel bay has slots for adding wheels to your Karibou rover, and also features built in stabilization struts and a generous storage area for storing resources and other items.

Text.Name: Heading (30)
Text.Text: Karibou Wheeled Storage Bay (short) This heavy wheel bay has slots for adding wheels to your Karibou rover, large battery banks, and storage space for resources and other items.

Text.Name: Heading (31)
Text.Text: Karibou Flatbed Wheel Bay This version of the Karibou's large wheel bay features a flat deck, ideal for attaching irregular or bulky parts for transport.

Text.Name: Heading (32)
Text.Text: Karibou Cargo Crate A flat storage crate designed as a payload module for the Karibou Expedition Rover, but also usable as low-profile radially attached storage.

Text.Name: Heading (33)
Text.Text: Karibou Cargo KIS Crate A flat storage crate designed as a payload module for the Karibou Expedition Rover, but also usable as low-profile radially attached storage. Suitable for holding KIS parts.

Text.Name: Heading (34)
Text.Text: Karibou Cargo Tank A flat storage tank designed as a payload module for the Karibou Expedition Rover, but also usable as low-profile radially attached storage.

Text.Name: Heading (35)
Text.Text: Karibou Radial Probe A small radial probe designed specifically for assisting in aligning VTOL craft, like the Karibou Rover. For optimal utility, place it on top of the vessel (i.e. "dorsal" side), with the arrow pointing forward.

Text.Name: Heading (36)
Text.Text: Karibou Control Module A 2.5m inline control module featuring a reaction wheel as well as high-thrust RCS modules.

Text.Name: Heading (37)
Text.Text: Karibou UKS Multi-Hub A module for the Karibou Expedition Rover that allows the attachment of standard Duna modules. Can also be used in place of an MKS Module Base to integrate with MKS Duna components, allowing for horizontal bases.

Text.Name: Heading (38)
Text.Text: Karibou S.A.B.R.E. Engine A radially mountable S.A.B.R.E. engine

Text.Name: Heading (39)
Text.Text: Deployable Emergency Shelter This emergency shelter can provide two Kerbals ample room for either a shorter-term mission, or emergency habitation on a long-term mission while they await rescue. Suitable for twelve months of habitation at full occupancy.

Text.Name: Heading (40)
Text.Text: Karibou VTOL Descent Engine A heavy twin VTOL engine designed to aid in landing the Karibou Expedition Rover. This all-in-one descent engine features thrust vectoring engines (up to 20 degrees of directional thrust), and can capture a modest amount of expelled propellant to recharge monopropellant tanks to aid in maneuvering.

Text.Name: Heading (41)
Text.Text: Karibou Modular Wheel - A collapsible wheel designed for integration with the Karibou expedition Rover.

Text.Name: Heading (1)
Text.Text: Core Concepts

Text.Name: Heading
Text.Text: Modular Kolonization Systems - MKS -

Text.Name: Text (2)
Text.Text:
Welcome to the wide and wonderful worlds of Umbra Space Industries' latest venture. A world leader in corrugated paper products, Umbra Space Industries is now applying their formidable boxing and packaging skills to their latest product – USI Modular Kolonization Systems!
MKS introduces a series of orbital and surface parts for habitation, resource exploitation, and construction. While the parts can be used purely for aesthetics, it is designed to provide a richer gameplay experience through the extension of existing mods, and/or enhancement of career mode.
You've made the right choice in coming here for information! This KSPedia entry will help you through each step of the mod, from Installation to optimizing that Eeloo research base!
